cut up.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to cut something into small pieces
cut up.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Could you cut the pizza up, please?
He cut the paper up into little pieces.
cut up.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to suddenly drive in front of a moving vehicle in a dangerous way
cut up.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Some idiot cut me up on the motorway.
cut up.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to behave in a noisy or rude way
cut up.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to react in an angry or violent way
cut up.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Careful how you approach him – he can cut up a bit rough if he’s got a mind to.
cut up.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to criticize someone in an unpleasant way
cut up.translation[1].definitions[0].def: very upset about something that has happened
cut up.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: He was very cut up about Stephen dying.
cut up.translation[2].definitions[0].def: someone who makes other people laugh by doing amusing things, especially in a situation when they should not do this
